title: Zest Package Definition v1.0
description: Schema for defining Zest packages. This describes the metadata, dependencies, and install instructions for a package in the Zest ecosystem.

name.description: Unique package name (lowercase, use hyphens if needed). Example: 'bun', 'my-tool'

description.description: 1-2 sentence summary of what the package does. Keep it short and clear.

license.description: License identifier (e.g., 'MIT', 'Apache-2.0', 'GPL-3.0'). Choose one from SPDX.

maintainer.description: Person or organization responsible. Format: 'name' or 'name <email>'

homepage.description: Main URL for the project, repo, or docs. Example: 'https://bun.sh'

tags.description: Optional. Keywords to help categorize the package. Example: ['runtime', 'javascript']

dependencies.description: Optional. Other packages this one depends on. Example: ['libssl', 'zlib']

conflicts.description: Optional. Packages that must not be installed with this one.

downloads.description: Per-platform downloadable package binaries. Keys like 'linux-x64', 'macos-arm64'.

source.description: Optional. Tarball or zip URL for the source code, for building from source.

install.description: Platform-specific install instructions. Each key (linux, macos, windows) maps to one install method.

download.description: Downloadable package file. Contains URL, checksum, and optional size.

url.description: Direct download URL to a .zip/.tar.gz/.exe/etc file.

sha256.description: SHA-256 checksum for verifying the file. Use shasum or openssl to generate it.

size.description: Optional. Size of the file in bytes (for display or validation).

binaryInstall.description: Install pre-built binary packages. Suitable for tools that provide ready-to-use executables.

binary.description: Name of the main executable to install. Example: 'bun'

binaries.description: Optional. List of additional binaries to install.

strip_components.description: Optional. Use when archive contents are nested. 1 removes top-level folder, etc.

post_install.description: Optional. Shell commands to run after install. Example: ['bun --help']

sourceInstall.description: Install from source code. Requires build tools like make, gcc, etc.

build_commands.description: Required. Shell commands to build from source. Example: ['make', 'make install']

scriptInstall.description: Install using a shell or PowerShell script. Useful for tools that provide their own install scripts.

script.description: URL or local path to a shell or PowerShell install script. Example: 'https://bun.sh/install'

args.description: Optional. Arguments passed to the script. Leave empty if not needed.
